summary: An email from Justin Houston, a Convergint Federal program manager, regarding security system installation at MCC New York. The email references a 2018 purchase order and indicates installation was delayed until after an unspecified 'incident'.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Program manager at Convergint Federal/SigNet Technologies who sent an email regarding the installation of security gear at MCC New York, referencing a 2018 purchase order and a subsequent incident.

events.title: Purchase Order Received
events.description: Convergint Federal received a purchase order for security gear to be installed at MCC New York.

events.title: Paperwork for IP Addresses Sent
events.description: Justin Houston sent paperwork to the site to submit for IP addresses needed to install the security system.

events.title: The Incident
events.description: An unspecified incident occurred, after which the security gear was finally installed at MCC New York.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705 (Convergint Federal/SigNet Technologies office)
keyFacts: The email discusses the installation of security gear at MCC New York, a federal detention center.
A purchase order for the gear was received on September 21, 2018, with delivery approximately 30 days later.
Installation was delayed because required IP addresses were never received from the site.
The security system was not installed until after an unspecified 'incident' occurred.
The correspondence is dated October 1, 2021, referencing events from 2018.
